questions.question_text: A network technician is asked to perform an unfamiliar task. Which of the following would the technician MOST likely reference?
Which of the following is a purpose of a syslog server?

choices.A: Aggregates switch logs for easier review and correlation
choices.D: Purges switch logs when they reach capacity
choices.B: Polls SNMP-enabled server logs for current status
choices.C: Distributes logging applications to monitoring servers

discussion.content: syslog servers are meant to store network device logs for review and analyzation. This includes repeaters, hubs, switches, routers, etc.
ASIC is a chip that can be programmed for a multitude of tasks, which virtual routers do not have.

questions.question_text: The lack of which of the following components might make a virtual router less efficient than a physical router?

discussion.content: cname record is like nicknames i guess.

questions.question_text: A company has a DNS record for the following address: products.companyXYZ.com. The company would like to add another record, sales.companyXYZ.com, which continually points to the same IP address as products.companyXYZ.com. Which of the following DNS record types would BEST accomplish this?

choices.D: Change the antenna type on the WAPs.
choices.B: Increase transmit power levels on the access points.
choices.A: Add more access points to the mesh network.

questions.question_text:
A wireless network is set up in a mesh configuration that has experienced recent growth. Some of the access points are four hops away in the mesh network.
Users at these access points are reporting slow download speeds despite being the sole users on the access point. Which of the following would BEST resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
Passleader shows this Q twice. Once with the answer given here and once with the answer as A (add more AP's)

Neither answer entirely satisfy this question, especially considering the Q states that those at hop 4 are the ONLY people on those AP's. I don't trust a lot of these answers.

comments.content: Some Mesh APs are just wireless repeaters... so wireless AP VS Wired AP

wireless mesh network means. one AP connected directly with wired. other are connected wireless with others.
Mesh wireless network is different from the extender. 
in mesh WAP , there is a dedicated antenna to make a dedicated connection with other AP.

discussion.content: How is A and C any different from eachother?
